pr_title: feat(clients/java): add user-agent to java client requests

timeline.message: feat(clients/java): add user-agent to java client requests
feat(clients/java): set client info in requests

timeline.bodyText:
This format seems a bit uncommon for user-agent. Usually, it has the format <product>/<version> (e.g. zeebe-client-java/0.24.0).
What do you think about changing it?
timeline.author: saig0

replies.bodyText: I'd happily change it but this is the format used in the C# and node clients so I figured it was better to stick to one format. Do you think it's better to break from that and change it here and in the Go clients?
replies.author: MiguelPires

replies.bodyText:
You're right. I also prefer one format for all clients. But I would also prefer a more common format.
Let's shortly ask the maintainers @Zelldon and @jwulf what they are thinking of changing the user-agent format?
replies.author: saig0

replies.bodyText: I fine with that. In the end it doesn't matter. It is just to find out which client is used at the cloud.
replies.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: Please create then issues in the corresponding clients.
replies.author: Zelldon

timeline.author: saig0

timeline.bodyText: The logger package looks a bit uncommon with .util. Maybe, we can have a logger for general or managing things io.zeebe.client.
timeline.author: saig0

timeline.message: feat(clients/java): set client info in requests' user-agent
feat(clients/java): set client info in requests' user-agent
